messages.message:
Team - is it possible to modify the HTTP response returned by an Instabase API call?
We are currently making a File Read API call but the HTTP response header is: application/octet-stream.... we are returning back a JSON object, how can we modify this HTTP Header to application/json?
Thanks
@Will @Bren
what’s the content-type header sent in the request?
doesn’t seem that our api accepts it
still returns the response as application/octet-stream

I don’t disagree. There’s lots of things we need to fix in our older APIs. :slightly_smiling_face: But I’m also terrified at the idea of changing a response in our file APIs, and the potential fallout from everyone relying on it (even if it’s broken). This might need to be a API V2 change? We even get angry tickets when we fix grammar/typos in our error message.
@Heymian a lot of times APIs enable the “Content-Type” heading so if it shows up, return back with that content-type otherwise just use the default
maybe that’s a good compromise of keeping things as is for existing calls but offering the option for future calls
